summary: The 'Fairness for the Trades Act' amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow qualified business trade expenses, specifically those related to specified business property used in certain trade fields (defined by NAICS codes), to be treated as qualified higher education expenses for 529 account purposes. This aims to support individuals pursuing careers in skilled trades by providing tax benefits for related expenses. The amendments apply to expenses paid in taxable years beginning after the Act's enactment.
